thread.title: See what these members of the Newcastle public are voting in the EU Referendum - and why
thread.title_full: See what these members of the Newcastle public are voting in the EU Referendum - and why

author: nechronicle
title: See what these members of the Newcastle public are voting in the EU Referendum - and why
text:
The video will start in 8 s Cancel Click to play Tap to play The Live Event you are trying to watch is either unavailable or has not started Please refresh this page in your browser to reload this live event video 
In the lead up to the much-discussed and momentous EU referendum vote on Thursday, we went onto the streets of Newcastle to find out how you, the public, will vote on June 23 and why. 
While there was a relatively even split between Brexit and remain supporters - a pattern which reflects the nationwide trend - a significant number of those asked to participate admitted to being undecided, or said they will simply not be voting at all. 
One woman, who has already voted to leave via a postal vote, told us she regrets her decision and wishes she could change it, as she’s not sure a leave vote would allow current socio-political situations in the UK to improve. 
Some of the reasons to remain that were mentioned included the idea that we are stronger united with Europe, as is our trade and the success of our large companies. 
In contrast, those who will vote leave thought that separating from the EU would allow us to better monitor immigration into the country, and the ability to better decide how money is spent. 
With opinion clearly divided across Remain and Brexit campaigns, and the considerable number of undecided or non-voters, it is anybody’s guess what the result will ultimately be on Friday, June 24. 
Watch our video above to listen to the opinions of those who shared them in the limelight of our cameras. The European Union debate
